bypassed html filtering
    url: http://m.baidu.com/from=844b/bd_page_type=1/ssid=0/uid=0/pu=usm%400%2Csz%401321_1001%2Cta%40utouch_2_2.2_3_533/baiduid=F85FF649F56188A5F4088A611318D2F3/w=0_10_%22SSL+received+a+record+that+exceeded+the+maximum+permissible%22/t=wap/l=0/tc?ref=www_utouch&lid=4864770987809327352&order=5&vit=osres&tj=www_normal_5_0_10&dict=-1&sec=37051&di=a4b2f338a3a82bfb&bdenc=1&nsrc=IlPT2AEptyoA_yixCFOxXnANedT62v3IEQGG_yhG2zuynE39fe_lItdnJ7HNKnSYXlLwxXCBeQoDljPcQ8loj11Oh3o6h8Zhjiq7tajptd8RS122qdVt2d4KUS5xz_HeiOl8vBUy0ARhMHY8nujjcgFbu4G
    saved filename: ssl received record exceeded maximum permissible length自由职业者和工作- Freelancer.com.xhtml

allowed video tag and showed image
    url: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VirtualBox
    filename: test web filter - video tag not removed, and shows image.html
    This url shows a jpg image in the browser. But syr.html.HtmlFirewallFilter strips it out.
    The jpg is embedded in html that is hidden inside a tag attribute:

        videopayload="<div class="mediaContainer" ...

    The python 2.7 HTMLParser.HTMLParser, and hence our HtmlFirewallFilter,
    does not correctly parse the nested double quotes.


        from html import firewall_html

        test1 = """
        <html>
            <body>
                <p onmouseout="alert(1)">
                Hover over this text, then move your mouse away.
                </p>
            </body>
        </html>
        """
        clean_test1 = firewall_html(test1)
        print clean_test1
